channel.title: math.AC updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.AC updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Bounds on the degrees of vector fields
item.description: arXiv:2403.09870v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this article, we study the generalized Poincare problem from the opposite perspective, by establishing lower bounds on the degree of the vector field in terms of invariants of the variety.
item.dc:creator: Marc Chardin, S. Hamid Hassanzadeh, Claudia Polini, Aron Simis, Bernd Ulrich

item.title: Representations from matrix varieties, and filtered RSK
item.description: arXiv:2403.09938v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Matrix Schubert varieties (Fulton '92) carry natural actions of Levi groups. Their coordinate rings are thereby Levi-representations; what is a combinatorial counting rule for the multiplicities of their irreducibles? When the Levi group is a torus, (Knutson-Miller '04) answers the question. We present a general solution, a common refinement of the multigraded Hilbert series, the Cauchy identity, and the Littlewood-Richardson rule. Our result applies to any ``bicrystalline'' algebraic variety; we define these using the operators of (Kashiwara '95) and of (Danilov-Koshevoi '05, van Leeuwen '06). The proof introduces a ``filtered'' generalization of the Robinson-Schensted-Knuth correspondence.
item.dc:creator: Abigail Price, Ada Stelzer, Alexander Yong

item.title: Even-Odd partition identities of G\"oellnitz-Gordon type
item.description: arXiv:2403.10189v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: In this paper, we prove a theorem which adds a new member to the famous G\"oellnitz-Gordon identities. We construct a "new system of recurrence formulas" in order to prove it.
item.dc:creator: Pooneh Afsharijoo

item.title: A comparison of Hochschild homology in algebraic and smooth settings
item.description: arXiv:2202.06573v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Consider a complex affine variety $\tilde V$ and a real analytic Zariski-dense submanifold V of $\tilde V$. We compare modules over the ring $O (\tilde V)$ of regular functions on $\tilde V$ with modules over the ring $C^\infty (V)$ of smooth complex valued functions on V. Under a mild condition on the tangent spaces, we prove that $C^\infty (V)$ is flat as a module over $O (\tilde V)$. From this we deduce a comparison theorem for the Hochschild homology of finite type algebras over $O (\tilde V)$ and the Hochschild homology of similar algebras over $C^\infty (V)$. We also establish versions of these results for functions on $\tilde V$ (resp. V) that are invariant under the action of a finite group G. As an auxiliary result, we show that $C^\infty (V)$ has finite rank as module over $C^\infty (V)^G$.
item.dc:creator: David Kazhdan, Maarten Solleveld

item.title: Symbolic Defect of Monomial Ideals
item.description: arXiv:2310.12280v4 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Given a monomial ideal $I$, we study two functions that quantify ways to measure the difference between symbolic powers and usual powers of $I$. In many cases we determine the asymptotic growth rate of these two functions. We also perform explicit computations by using the symbolic polyhedron.
item.dc:creator: Benjamin R. Oltsik
